title: What is the most powerful and accurate OCR software for Japanese text? - Quora

response.answer_text: That depends on which device you are working on to do Japanese OCR. Generally speaking, a desktop japanese OCR always bring the best OCR results, for windows users, try Readiris 17  for mac users, try cisdem PDF Converter OCR  If you are a Japanese learner and want to learn or translate Japanese anytime anywhere on a mobile device: for ios users, try scan&translate, it helps recognize japanese text,then translate to other languages;  for Android users, try Yomiwa, it also recognize text from image or captures, then the built-in dictionary will explain the text for you.

I looked for the answer to this question last year. High-quality OCR software that can meet business needs is expensive, and I was looking for software priced at $3,000 or less. I found WinReader PRO (http://mediadrive.jp/products/wrp/), which fit my budget and requirements. It excels at accurately recognizing Japanese print and can process a large amount of material automatically. However, it does not recognize handwriting very well.
